title: New look for the HTML admin pages
description: As discussed on the mailing list (http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/lucene-solr-dev/200611.mbox/%3cf767f0600611290110p433863c4gca26e3f7d0fc89ee@mail.gmail.com%3e), I'm going to attach the suggested designs here.

comments.author: Bertrand Delacretaz
comments.content:
Design by Nicolas Barbay (nicolas@nicolas@sarraux-dessous.ch).

This is my favorite. I like the logo as well, maybe with a darker green for the magnifying glass.

comments.author: Bertrand Delacretaz
comments.content:
White on black, also by Nicolas.

Personally I don't like this one, too noisy for an admin interface IMHO.

comments.author: Bertrand Delacretaz
comments.content:
solr-green.jpg gets my vote.

Note that the menu box at the right should be ignored, it's a design tool only.

comments.author: Bertrand Delacretaz
comments.content: Got Nicolas' email wrong: nicolas (put at here) sarraux-dessous.ch

comments.author: Otis Gospodnetic
comments.content: The black version is too dark ("emotionally").  Let's go with something happy!

comments.author: Hoss Man
comments.content:
i kinda like the black acctually .. but that may largely be due to my prefering the "fire" solr logo over the futuristic magnifying glass (the red/orange contrasts nicely with the black/grey.

to my mind, the "Solr" "Sun" connection has allways been really cool ... having a sun theme incorperatred into the look of the pages (either as part of the logo or as a background image) might be cool nd would definitely fit with a warmer color scheme like the green.

(what if the pages were predominitely green, but near the top of hte page the green transitioned to blue sky as a horizon of hills, and the Solr logo had sun for the "o" ?)

comments.author: Bertrand Delacretaz
comments.content:
I agree that it'd be good to have a closer connection to the sun. Nicolas says the hard part is in avoiding the "cheap holiday club" look 

Maybe solar flares would help make a clear connection while staying subtle, I like the power that such images evoke:

http://hesperia.gsfc.nasa.gov/sftheory/fulldisk.htm
http://perso.orange.fr/universimmedia/soleil/lexique/protuberances.htm

I told Nicolas to think about it, but if others have ideas, let's see them!

comments.author: Bertrand Delacretaz
comments.content: Here's a revised, more sunny design including the SOLR-84 logo

comments.author: Bertrand Delacretaz
comments.content: The "more sunny design" is  solr-green-sunny.jpg  (why doesn't Jira keep the connection between attachments and their comments?)

comments.author: Otis Gospodnetic
comments.content: I like the sunny look better than the current one, but I have to say I like the current logo better than the futuristic (soul-less?) new one.  The current logo makes the Sun connection clear, while the new one completely removes it.  The current logo is warm, the new one is cold.  I prefer warms things in life in general, so this reflects my usual taste and attitude.
